CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The non-fullerene PSC fabricated from the blend of PTATDPP and di-PBI exhibits a PCE of 4.23% with V OC = 0.77 V , J SC = 9.8 mA cm^-2 and FF = 0.56 ( Fig.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid entities that clearly refer to "Material name" in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PTATDPP |
| di-PBI |

I removed "V OC" and "J SC" from the table since they do not clearly refer to material names. "V OC" is a measure of open-circuit voltage, and "J SC" is a measure of short-circuit current, both of which are properties of a solar cell, not material names.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The non-fullerene PSC fabricated from the blend of PTATDPP and di-PBI exhibits a PCE of 4.23% with V OC = 0.77 V , J SC = 9.8 mA cm^-2 and FF = 0.56 ( Fig.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE |
| V OC |
| J SC |
| FF |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with only the entities that clearly refer to material properties:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE |
| V OC |
| J SC |

These three properties are all related to the performance of the non-fullerene PSC material:

* PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency)
* V OC (Open-Circuit Voltage)
* J SC (Short-Circuit Current Density)

Paragraph: The non-fullerene PSC fabricated from the blend of PTATDPP and di-PBI exhibits a PCE of 4.23% with V OC = 0.77 V , J SC = 9.8 mA cm^-2 and FF = 0.56 ( Fig.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid entities that clearly refer to "Value of material property":

The following entities do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and were removed from the table:

* FF (not a property value, but a measure of fill factor)
